programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi learn that big cash comes in small packages, an indecisive Darrell finds himself in a bidder's quandary and Mark Balelo is back with all his usual bravado.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Former employee Tressa returns to sell the Rolex that got her sacked and Les struggles to control the situation when insults start to fly between her and Ashley.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes on the rampage when he finds out a thief has been on the premises, and a customer selling a guitar signed by Kid Rock reveals a valuable secret.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: An internationally-inspired signature dish sees one chef's dream of winning go up in flames. The Crossfire Round offers a chance to catch up and the judges enjoy Greek feasts.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Brothers Marty and Rick Lagina find a mysterious 20-foot high void deep inside the Money Pit, just before diver John Chatterton successfully reaches the bottom of borehole 10-X.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The hunters try a new method for fighting back at poachers. Meanwhile, another team engages in some risky open water hunting.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: A new recruit has to save a snowplough stuck in an icy river, while Colin's first job of the season forces him into an unfamiliar role that tests his leadership skills.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed picture of the original Star Trek cast and an Eli Whitney Civil War revolver both pique the Pawn Stars' interest.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine a letter from Founding Father James Monroe and a promotional Playboy chair. Chum tries to reinvent himself in the image of Hugh Hefner.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley comes out from behind the security glass to confront a menacing customer, and there is more trouble when a man claims he has been robbed in the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley is in trouble with Seth and Les, who discover she is to blame for the shop's current cash crisis.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams bargain for an old Ford Transit and an ageing tractor to strip to a shell and sell on as parts for the highest sum of cash possible. Narrated by John Challis (car dealer Boycie in Only Fools and Horses).

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: The explorers finally reach the bottom of borehole 10-X, while a whole new void is discovered deep in the Money Pit.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts investigate reported sightings of strange flying objects and mysterious lights in the sky, questioning whether they could be signs of extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Expert investigations into the possibility that reptilian aliens are more than a pop-culture creation and a favourite of works of science-fiction.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick unrolls work by Shepard Fairey, the artist that produced the famous President Obama posters. Corey and Chumlee look for a deal on a Mork figurine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick uncovers an 1800s first edition book about the Underground Railroad, as well as a set of baseball cards given to troops during Desert Shield.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Almost the Greatest Show on Earth
programme.desc: Dave puts a bid in for a unit of motor parts, much to the surprise of the buyers, who thought he was broke.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod take an interest in a furniture locker in Upland, California. Dave bids for a locker full of jewellery, but it remains to be seen if the contents are real.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: An internationally-inspired signature dish sees one chef's dream of winning go up in flames. The Crossfire Round offers a chance to catch up and the judges enjoy Greek feasts.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth finds himself in the cross hairs after his new employee makes a big mistake, while Ashley is forced to face one of her most insulting customers yet.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: As a storm threatens to knock out the shop's power, Seth hatches an emergency plan - only for it to be shot down by his father.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams bargain for an old Ford Transit and an ageing tractor to strip to a shell and sell on as parts for the highest sum of cash possible. Narrated by John Challis (car dealer Boycie in Only Fools and Horses).

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Stories of UFO sightings and alien abductions, beginning with reports of multiple bright aerial lights near Tinley Park, Illinois, in 2004.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate alleged sightings of UFOs during the Black Death, and examine the theory that aliens may have inflicted the disease on the human race.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: The explorers finally reach the bottom of borehole 10-X, while a whole new void is discovered deep in the Money Pit.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Ursula is in need of a change of luck with her shop suffering from poor sales, while Rick and Cindy argue about marriage.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: All's Well That Ends Wildly Ridiculous
programme.desc: Rick and Cindy try to secure a prized locker, and all their hopes are pinned on the prospect that it might contain a piece of hockey history.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: The competition really hots up in the Crossfire Round and the Feast of Fire sees the chefs serving up the ultimate comfort food.

programme.title: Ozzy & Jack's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Birmingham veteran rocker Ozzy Osbourne agrees to go to one of son Jack's favourite cities, providing they are able to secure a tour of the White House.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Dwaine hits a breaking point, Willie realises he is losing money, Kristi hunts with her son and Glenn fulfils a lifelong dream.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi find a rare jewellery box, while Dave is reluctant to join in the bidding wars.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and a pawnbroker toss a coin for a box of collectable scout badges.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Rob Beckett, Gary Delaney, Sara Pascoe and Josh Widdicombe on the topical comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on the week's major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games. First shown in June 2014.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: BBC Breakfast presenter Steph McGovern takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from October 2018, with Pointless co-host Richard Osman and broadcaster Joan Bakewell joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedians Lee Mack and Ruby Wax and Hairy Biker Dave Myers to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include Top Gear, new-age books and chunky chips.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Kevin Bridges, Phill Jupitus and Sara Pascoe
programme.desc: Kevin Bridges hosts the stand-up show from the Hammersmith Apollo in London, warming up the audience before introducing routines by DJ, Buzzcocks regular and all-round funnyman Phill Jupitus and actress-comedienne Sara Pascoe, making her Apollo debut.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian must try to keep his temper in check as he becomes a lord's butler for the day and is challenged to look after the gentry at an exclusive dinner party.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Thanks to back flips and rail rides, Tim and Gendle are in BMX bike heaven. With the clock ticking it is down to Joe and the build team to construct the ultimate BMX set-up.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: With a mandate from their wives, Andrew and Kevin create a kid-friendly play area with zip lines and a man-sized baby bouncer.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: The practical pair of brothers build a snug mobile shack so they can venture out onto the frozen lake.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Pickers Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz make waves when they hit the road in a one-of-a-kind rocket car.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are in Leamington Spa, and the up-market town brings out the businessman in Heavy D who gets more than he bargained for in one auction.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori Bernier discover more potential bargains in storage lockers, including a trio of motorhomes, bronze statues and jet skis.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike, Frank, Robbie and Danielle all hit the road in search of treasure, to see what the jam-packed yards and barns of Virginia have in store for them.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The amateur race arrives into Valkenburg aan de Geul in the Netherlands, traditionally the finish of the Amstel Gold Classic cycling race.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Rival teams of amateur racers pit their wacky, gravity-powered soapbox vehicles in a downhill race against the clock in Paris.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May pay tribute to Saab, the Swedish car manufacturer that created several successful models since the late 1940s, but has now ceased production. Richard Hammond takes the passenger's seat in a Skoda rally car that races a rocket-propelled flying man, and actor Matt Smith gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car. Jeremy also shreds the tyres of the noisy Maserati GranTurismo MC Stradale and the 510bhp Mercedes-Benz C63 AMG Black Series.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter continues his examination of how the car became an everyday part of people's lives, exploring the weird world of small vehicles. He discovers how austerity and fears of congestion led to European disasters in the shape of Britain's infamous three-wheelers, French death traps and German absurdities, and also takes to the battlefield to settle one of the greatest rivalries in car history.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters embark on a road trip across Australia's Northern Territory in fast, luxurious GT cars, with Jeremy Clarkson choosing a BMW M6 Gran Coupe, Richard Hammond picking a Bentley Continental GT V8 and James May opting for a Nissan GT-R. The trio set out on an adventure that takes in crocodile-infested rivers, a race around a vast opencast mine and an encounter with one of the world's longest lorries, concluding with an unusual challenge involving a farm, their cars and 4,000 cows. Plus, 24 star Kiefer Sutherland takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test the KTM X-Bow, the Morgan Three Wheeler and the Caterham R500 at Donington Park racing circuit. Jeremy also creates his own version of the Battle of Britain using an aircraft-engined Bentley and a flame-spitting BMW.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to discover if they can go motor racing for less than it costs to play golf. There's also a double helping of guests, with rock star Slash and Formula One driver Kimi Raikkonen taking to the track in Reasonably Priced Cars. Richard also gets behind the wheel of the BMW M5, which is powered by a twin-turbo V8 engine instead of the high-revving V10 of its predecessor.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Five new contestants - Iain Stirling, Joe Thomas, Lou Sanders, Paul Sinha and Sian Gibson - complete tasks under the watchful eye of Greg Davies and Alex Horne.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedian Lolly Adefope, journalist and presenter Dan Walker, presenter Sarah Greene and comedian Miles Jupp take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedian Josh Widdicombe, choirboy-turned-presenter Aled Jones and DJ Sara Cox join Frank Skinner for the comedy panel show, competing to have their pet hates banished to the infamous room. Their gripes include Lord of the Rings, fish bones and death metal.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Broadcaster and former MP Gyles Brandreth, comedian and presenter Adam Hills and singer Melanie C - the woman who will forever be known as Sporty Spice - compete to have their pet hates banished to the infamous room. Host Frank Skinner has to choose between dislikes including passwords, £2 coins and movie spoilers.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Lee Nelson, Stewart Francis and Paul Chowdhry
programme.desc: Cheeky Londoner Lee Nelson plays host for a 'well good' session of stand-up from the Hammersmith Apollo in London, warming up the audience before introducing routines by Canadian funnyman Stewart Francis and observational comic Paul Chowdhry.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Angela Barnes, Miles Jupp, Romesh Ranganathan and Josh Widdicombe on the comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on major news stories from June 2014 and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The race continues for Taskmaster Greg Davies's alluring golden head trophy. Today, an interesting selection of facial hair and a fascinating collection of continuous noises.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended version. Star Wars actress Carrie Fisher and comedians Bill Bailey and Jimmy Carr join regular panellist Alan Davies for a festive edition of the comedy quiz. Host Stephen Fry asks them a range of unusual questions on topics related to Christmas, with points being awarded for interesting answers as well as correct ones.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright is reluctant to buy a new suit until Nurse Gladys Emmanuel persuades him to. He agrees, but only if I can be made in the same style as his old one. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright expands his empire by opening a mobile shop in a bid to impress Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, but the enterprise is cut short by a close encounter with some perishables.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Hermann Goering - the dashing, young, down-on-his-luck war veteran who turned into an extravagant, heartless, obese, drug-addled Nazi billionaire.

programme.title: From World War to Cold War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring the end of the Second World War, and how the plans for the future agreed by the Allied nations at the Yalta Conference in 1945 broke down.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the crime drama. Leo receives devastating news from home - his wife and daughter have been involved in a hit-and-run accident, prompting him to set off for Sheffield immediately. Meanwhile, Nikki is called out to the river when the bodies of two unidentified women are discovered, both shot execution-style. William Gaminara, Tom Ward and Emilia Fox star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Lance Powell goes undercover in a gay bar in a successful operation to catch a dealer selling lethal crystal meth, but his personal life takes a knock when partner Mark announces he's leaving the Met. Difficult decisions have to be made about a young tearaway when he's accused of mugging an old man, and a remorseful Terry reconsiders his relationship with Lucy after letting Bradley down yet again.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Billy is still being held by the police on suspicion of murder. Meanwhile, Pearce and Gregg try to rescue two boys trapped on a rubbish dump.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Angela's career causes problems for her and Chris and Major Forrester is forced to make a difficult decision. Starring Fiona Bell and James Callis.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Joe receives some bad news from Collette, and his actions end up getting him into trouble. Meanwhile, an unexpected guest opens old wounds for Sam.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Lance Powell goes undercover in a gay bar in a successful operation to catch a dealer selling lethal crystal meth, but his personal life takes a knock when partner Mark announces he's leaving the Met. Difficult decisions have to be made about a young tearaway when he's accused of mugging an old man, and a remorseful Terry reconsiders his relationship with Lucy after letting Bradley down yet again.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jac's manipulative behaviour causes Elliot to catch Joseph and Martha kissing during their shadowing assignment, while Abra has to think fast after Dan finds him taking more HIV drugs from the pharmacy. Matt is displeased to discover Nikki has been lying to get his attention, and the nurses start a sweepstake to cash in on the uncertainty surrounding the paternity of Connie's baby.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie reluctantly agrees to drop his application in the custody battle, and takes his anger out on Dan for organising a major incident exercise on the ward. Meanwhile, Holly fears the stalker has visited her home and Duffy develops problems with her pregnancy. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson and Cathy Shipton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Piece of the Pie
programme.desc: Neil Manson returns to Sun Hill to work on the murder of a gay man and Phil Hunter spots a pattern in similar recent crimes. Lance Powell teams up with Laura Bryant to investigate a spate of robberies for which the local vicar turns out to be the chief suspect. Mark leaves his partner distraught when he moves out to find some space, and Cindy urges her reluctant husband to open the results of the paternity test.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Steve's big day doesn't turn out quite as planned, Pat has to face up to some unpleasant truths about Frank, and Cindy sneaks away from the Square for a secret reunion.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle returns from hospital to a nasty suprise, Carol and Alan realise that Sonia's birthday may be anything but happy, and Sanjay finds an unexpected visitor in his flat.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Billy is charged with murder, and an accident in a college science laboratory leads to a horrific fire. Meanwhile, Carole gets her revenge on Davies.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Will's marriage hits rock bottom and Beth must pass on devastating news to a friend. Amanda Burton stars.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The townsfolk are still coming to terms with Sally's death, while Danny and Cady move into Kim's house to make space for the Boothes - leading to a declaration of love. Cathy Saunders' adoption application places Anna on the horns of a dilemma when she realises her friend is addicted to painkillers, and the factory helps out with the children's art fair - albeit in an unusual way.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Chris inherits a Greek cafe, which Sharon runs on his behalf - with Tracey as her skivvy and Dorien making the sandwiches. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: An old school friend of Audrey's wishes to visit, but is unaware of her former classmate's unfortunate circumstances, so the former lady of the manor arranges for DeVere to entertain her. Classic comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Nora Batty invites Compo up to her bedroom, but it proves to be an entirely innocent invitation as she merely wishes him to remove a mangle and deliver it to a friend. However, the nature of the item creates all sorts of problems. Long-running comedy, starring Bill Owen and Kathy Staff.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour departs for a new teaching job, leaving Clegg and Compo at a loose end now he is no longer around to drag them into his eccentric schemes. However, they do not realise an old friend is about to return to the village. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: A couple attempt to sue their council after developing medical conditions they claim were caused by a local mobile phone mast used to transmit internal police communications. Meanwhile, Deed is approached by the wife of a former Iraqi minister who says her family were poisoned and killed by depleted uranium used in the British Army's shells.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Danny and Steve 'welcome' new boss Ted Case into the UCOS office in Sasha's absence, but for all his experience, keen eye for detail and a killer instinct for detecting liars, they aren't as sold on his superstitious quirks. While trying to work one another out, the team treads carefully in the case of a murdered vicar who received racist hate mail in the lead up to his death. With emotions running high, it's up to Ted to pull together his new unit and keep the peace in one of UCOS's most sensitive cases. Starring Larry Lamb, Denis Lawson and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is called to the scene of a drive-by shooting, but the case proves less clear-cut than expected when evidence emerges that someone returned fire. The vehicle used is soon traced to an abandoned industrial unit, where a decomposing corpse is uncovered - and Nikki resolves to find out the true cause of death. Guest starring Craig Kelly and Freema Agyeman.

programme.title: Race & Revolution: Is Changing Going To Come?

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Fern Britton presents the kitchen challenge, which sees her husband - This Morning chef Phil Vickery - taking another nine amateurs through three tests of their culinary skills. They begin by finely slicing fennel bulbs, before filleting and skinning cod, with only the best three going forward to the final challenge, which sees them cooking the fish with whatever ingredients they choose from the larder.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV Live: Royal Ascot
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present behind-closed-doors coverage of the opening day of the festival, featuring the 1.50 Queen Anne Stakes and supporting races including the 2.25 Ribblesdale Stakes and 3.35 King's Stand Stakes. With analysis from Jason Weaver, Kevin Blake and Johnny Murtagh, reports by Luke Harvey, Mick Fitzgerald and Matt Chapman, commentary by Richard Hoiles and social stable interaction from Oli Bell.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Ollie, Suzanne, Rachel and Nick pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa and Martin search for a nursery now that Janice has left, and Mrs Tishell is shocked to find out that Al has very high blood pressure. Louisa also helps with the diagnosis of a pupil, which spurs her on to explore the possibilities of a change of career. This is not welcome news for Martin, who dislikes any kind of change, even if it could be for the better. Elsewhere, Ruth is approached about selling her farm. Starring Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz, Selina Cadell and Ian McNeice.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts six more contestants through their paces to see who will have the opportunity to answer 15 questions to win the prize of £1,000,000. Each player has four lifelines - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50:50 and Ask the Host - at their disposal.

programme.title: Alexander Armstrong's Land of the Midnight Sun
programme.desc: The presenter continues his epic 8,000-mile journey halfway around the Arctic Circle deep in mid-winter. He embarks on the second leg of his odyssey, beginning in Iceland before travelling to the icy wilderness of Greenland. Along the way, Alexander snorkels over a vast underwater crevasse separating two continental landmasses and wrestles with a female Viking. He also joins two Danish Special Forces soldiers and their huskies, who have the loneliest job on the planet, and witnesses an array of natural wonders.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Unbelievable Moments Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents a selection of extraordinary eyewitness footage filmed by members of the public, including the dramatic story of an amateur pilot who built his own plane, but then lost his propeller mid-flight and had to try to land it without any power. A local resident in northern California tries to flee what goes down in history as the state's deadliest wildfire, and a cliff collapse at a popular tourist spot in Greece causes chaos.

programme.title: Ross Kemp Living With
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part special to begin the second series, the actor and film-maker examines the real-life impact of dementia. He meets Scott Mitchell, the husband of his former on-screen mum Barbara Windsor, who was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2014. Ross also travels to Leatherhead, Surrey, where he stays with Jerry Beckman, an actor, magician and keen sportsman who has early-onset dementia and Parkinson's disease.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how to make Parmesan cheese, and the key to keeping the runways operating at the world's busiest airports. Plus, manufacturing reclining chairs.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a V8-powered Land Rover Defender for less than £5,000, that modifications expert Edd China can turn into a modern urban vehicle.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Pickers Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a massive warehouse in Chicago filled with cast-off treasures, including some superstar sports memorabilia that are a 'total slam dunk'.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: In a break with tradition, the team designs a bike suitable for mass production. After a slow start, Vinnie DiMartino gets a boost when he receives some news.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Fierce winds cause chaos for small planes on Halloween, while Ariel has to cope during a blackout.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe visits Arkansas to perform dung beetle research, then heads to West Virginia where he attempts to make glass art.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacture of inflatable safety devices, Braille typewriters and carbon-fibre cellos, and how their production processes have changed over the years.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Carbon Fibre Masts/Fortune Cookies/Imax Projectors/Roller Chains
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind carbon-fibre masts, fortune cookies, Imax projectors and roller chains.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How one of the world's most valuable metals, platinum, is mined. Plus, the production of manga comics and a look at how lemons are turned into an Italian after-dinner drinks.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry and Sam are back in Devon in search of new bargains. They meet Rodney at his workshop, full of signs, petrol pumps, vintage British cars and lots of rust! Rodney finds it hard to part with some items, but eventually a deal is struck...

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: In Worcestershire, bike guru Henry Cole and ace mechanic Sam Lovegrove meet a farmer with a shed full of bikes that don't appeal to the guys. However, there's a surprise waiting in a nearby field.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Elliot Neese takes his new vessel to the dangerous blue crab grounds, while alliances are forming on the Bering Sea.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: In Sheepyards, the Bushmen are desperate for a breakthrough after a run of bad luck. In White Cliffs, the Young Guns are under financial strain and fall out over their new mine.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Swansea, a huge barge is ripped apart. Meanwhile, in London, six tower blocks are demolished and on the south coast, scrap queens search for valuable scrap material.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to get his hands on one of his dad's favourites - a Ford Popular, a car known for being variable in its quality.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini bids on a 1949 BMV Veritas and hopes to get a classic Thor motorbike up and running.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini visits McPherson College looking for three apprentices to join his team. The students assemble a Model T and the winners are announced.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason Plato and Karun Chandhok test two new sports SUVs, while Vicki Butler-Henderson checks out a 3.6l V6 turbocharged American muscle costing a cool £500,000 - the ultra-exclusive Ford GT.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: In Sheepyards, the Bushmen are desperate for a breakthrough after a run of bad luck. In White Cliffs, the Young Guns are under financial strain and fall out over their new mine.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: On the blue crab grounds, the competition leads to more deceit amongst the captains and Junior's betrayal of his alliance with Keith comes back to haunt him.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys uncover toy cars worth as much as the real thing, and a stash of custom motorbikes with an incredible backstory.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: iDrew Pritchard hts the road with upholsterer Craig. In Derbyshire a 15th-century house has some Victorian dining chairs with potential, and the duo also visit an antique centre in Lincolnshire.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In West Yorkshire, locals watch as cooling towers are blown up. Plus, in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, a mansion is demolished and in Essex once-luxurious supercars are taken apart.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a V8-powered Land Rover Defender for less than £5,000, that modifications expert Edd China can turn into a modern urban vehicle.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Tunnel Rats are under extra pressure as rival miners close in on their claim. Plus, the Bushmen must brave an abandoned mine to remove a dead animal.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits the Lambretta Scooter Museum in Weston-super-Mare, and in Walsall, West Midlands, there is a historic haul in one of the UK's last leather factories.

programme.title: Plane Reclaimers
programme.desc: Three airbuses come in from a recently defunct Lithuanian airline. The arrivals mean the team is handed the daunting task of taking off an engine worth up to $6,000,000

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: In La Linea, a car hiding contraband cigarettes is stopped at the checkpoint with Gibraltar. Plus, at the port of Barcelona, one phone call sets off a major drug bust. Series following the interventions of Spain's Security and Customs Services at the nation's borders to combat the constant threat from drugs, weapons and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: A grisly arrival at Madrid Airport shocks even the most hardened Civil Guards. A passenger suitcase carrying suspect packets cause a stir in Barcelona Airport.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at ways to weave an authentic Turkish carpet, and how helicopter blade technology is being used to make cross country skis. Plus, the practicalities behind the Niagara Falls.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how seaweed is turned into sushi wrapping, how beer bottles that last for 15 years are made, and how surfers try to keep themselves safe from sharks.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of an armoured van suggests professional crooks are at work - but two of the perpetrators are discovered to be former law enforcement personnel.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A woman identifies a dead body as her missing sister Annie - but Annie is still alive.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The hunt for 18-year-old Kelsey Smith, who disappeared from a Kansas Mall in June 2007. The only clue detectives had was the haunting final images of her on surveillance video. The case turned into a murder investigation when Kelsey's body was recovered from a lake in Missouri a month later.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of retailer Harvey Fuson in January 2011. The 66-year-old was well-loved by members of his local community and the manner of his death shocked the Tennessee town of Cumberland Gap as well as the entire Tri-State area.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: FBI agents discover the bodies of three drug dealers floating in a river and begin to suspect they may have been murdered by a group of corrupt police officers.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team faces a logistical nightmare when it rescues a mule in need of urgent medical attention, but then has to figure out how to transport it to HQ.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A look at the work of Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown and his most embarrassing cases, including a golden retriever that has developed a nasty condition.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori seeks out the perfect dress for an insecure bridesmaid with body image issues, while Emily's insulting outbursts threaten to ruin her friendships.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Tammi has just 10 weeks until her wedding and is looking for a princess gown with Cinderella sleeves.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Professional dancer Karina is looking for a dress different to the costumes she usually wears in her shows, but loves every gown in sight and has trouble making a decision.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three Brits are given 800 euros to spend at an antiques market in Toulouse, looking for items to upcycle before trying to sell on for a profit back in north London.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield, an unusual Harley-Davidson motorbike, an antique flapper purse and a pair of solid gold coins keep Dan and his assistant Ellie busy doing high-end deals. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, staff broker a deal on a fur coat and ring, and a 100-year-old music player.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Max Mixson rescues a young foal with a dislocated knee, after which every second counts as the team executes a seizure warrant and rushes it back.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An emaciated mare is rescued, and animal protection officers seize two Great Danes that were left home alone.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How the Texas Rangers have progressed from a group to protect settlers in the 19th century to a sophisticated law-enforcement agency.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How investigators are devoting time to cracking cartels in a sinister criminal underground spawned by the prevalence of drug trafficking.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 42-year-old Patricia Viola, who vanished from her New Jersey home in February 2001, shortly after a routine telephone conversation with her mother. A bone fragment was found locally just over a year later, but it would be a another decade until DNA advancements allowed its identity to be positively confirmed after comparisons were made with samples provided by Viola's two children.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Vermont teenager Brianna Maitland, who vanished after leaving her family's farm after dropping out of high school, intent on getting her life back on track. Four days after the 17-year-old was last seen by friends in March 2004, her slightly damaged car was recovered from outside an abandoned farmhouse.

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The actress looks behind the headlines at the baffling mysteries, cold cases and compelling real-life dramas to uncover what really happened.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: A Dress Like None the Rest
programme.desc: A model who has worn many wedding dresses for photo shoots fears the gown for her own big day will not feel special as a result. A man helps his daughter find the right dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: A Thorn in the Bride's Side
programme.desc: A beauty queen visits the shop hoping to find a dress she loves and her mother-in-law approves of. Another customer has to deal with an opinionated friend.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Brides-to-be Danielle and Kathryn want the same gown - and there's only one in the sale. Meanwhile, Jessica is in search of one very specific dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: A Comedian Walks into a Bridal Salon
programme.desc: Comedian Kathy Griffin enlists Randy's help in making use of the salon's mannequins to give her former assistant the surprise of her life.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tony Danza arrives at the salon to help his Broadway co-star find the perfect bridal costume for her role in their new musical, Honeymoon in Vegas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Mike Sorrentino arrives at Kleinfeld to help Melissa find her wedding gown. However, Mike and his brothers steal the spotlight.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: There's No Easy Way to Say This
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs and Lisa Joyner meet Susan, who is desperate for a mother-daughter relationship and searching for both her biological mother and the daughter she placed for adoption.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. A tumultuous relationship with her husband caused Tamy Lyn's weight to reach more than 500lbs. Isolated from the outside world, she needs help to restart her life.

programme.title: My 3000lb Family
programme.desc: The family's explosive fight during Ed's surgery leaves Casey doubtful of surgery for himself. Meanwhile, Amanda undergoes testing to see if her cancer has spread.

programme.title: My Naked Secret
programme.desc: A woman with tubular breasts tries to regain her self confidence by undergoing surgery.

programme.title: My Naked Secret
programme.desc: A woman who has struggled for years with large breasts has extensive surgery and seeks advice from psychotherapist Linda Papadopoulous to restore her confidence.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A seemingly charming and generous man who targets vulnerable women for his vicious attacks is tracked in a country-wide manhunt.
